action.action-desc: Mr. Weber of Texas introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Gun-Free School Zones Act of 1990 to permit qualified law enforcement officers, qualified retired law enforcement officers, and persons not prohibited by State law from carrying a concealed firearm to carry a firearm, and to discharge a firearm in defense of self or others, in a school zone.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protect Against School Shootings Act or the PASS Act.

section.header: Use of firearms in school zones by qualified law enforcement officers, qualified retired law enforcement officers, and persons not prohibited by State law from carrying a concealed firearm
section.text: Section 922(q) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in clause (vi), by striking or at the end;
in clause (vii), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: by a person who, under section 926B or 926C or the law of a State, may carry a concealed firearm.

subparagraph.text: in clause (iii), by striking or at the end;
in clause (iv), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and

clause.text: by a person who, under section 926B or 926C or the law of a State, may carry a concealed firearm.
